projects.description:
Tech Degree Project #6:

This website that you currently are on is it! This is a static porfolio website using Express and Node.js. In this project I learned how to start a Express project, spin up a web server, and create routes and build templates using Pug.

Tech Degree Project #5:

Using Fetch API to use Random User Generator API (https://randomuser.me/) to grab information for 12 random “employees,” and use that data to build a prototype for an Awesome Startup employee directory.

I was to create a JS file and add link it in the HTML. My job was to use a 'GET' API request to get 12 random employess from the "randomuser.me" website. I was also assigned to build a "Modal" profile when a indvidual profile is clicked.

Tech Degree Project #4:

Using OOP and Javascript, I built a game similar to "Hangman". In this project I learned about OOP, building Classes and calling methods from those classes.

Tech Degree Project #3:

Using a prebuilt HTML/CSS form my assignment was to add functionallity to it using JavaScript. I made the form more user freindly when selecting options like "t-shirt design" only the selected design colors appear in the color dropdown menu. I also used Javascript to make the "Register for Activities" functional and user freindly. When a class is clicked on, if there is another class that has a conflicting time and day it is disabled. Finally I used Regex or Regular expressions to validate the form and payment section

Tech Degree Project #2:

Using a common web development technique called "pagination" I used a JS file containing 42 random students and looped thru and displayed 9 per page. I also added Javascript to include pageination buttons on the bottom that the user can click on

My very first Team Treehouse Tech degree project!

After learning the basics of JS, and DOM manipulation I built a quote generator to loop thru a object array randomly. For bonus points I added a timer and built a random background color generator
